fields.description:
h4. Error

When saving a page, the following error occurs:

{noformat}Oops - an error has occurred:
Cause

javax.servlet.ServletException: Servlet execution threw an exception
     at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:313) 

caused by: java.lang.StackOverflowError
     at org.owasp.validator.html.scan.AntiSamyDOMScanner.recursiveValidateTag(AntiSamyDOMScanner.java:360) 

Stack Trace:[hide]
javax.servlet.ServletException: Servlet execution threw an exception{noformat}

h4. Diagnosis:

Often occurs when data has been copied and pasted from other Confluence pages. To check Click Tools > View Storage Format on the trouble page. Here you will likely see some tags that had not been closed, such as:

{noformat}<strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong><strong>{noformat}

h4. Workaround:

# Copy the page from *Tools > Copy*
# While in edit mode, Select All content, and Cut to clipboard.
# Save page.
# Edit copy of page, and paste all content back in.
# Save page.
# Use this copy now as the original page.
fields.summary: ServletException while saving pages with corrupt formatting
Space templates are unavailable from the templates menu

fields.description:

# Create a space
# Edit that space so that no homepage is specified
# Click create->Product Requirements ( File List)
# Enter a title for the page and hit save

We use a template for storing meeting notes. Beginning 10 Dec. the table within our meeting notes displays the header at the bottom of the table in read mode. In edit mode, the table header appears at the top as expected.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description Center alignment at the tool bar does not work on Image on a confluence page. h3. Action Done and Observation Replicated this on my test instance by pasting a image to a blank page. Select the image and test on the alignment button on the editor tool bar. The left and right alignment is working fine for the image but not the center alignment. From the storage format view we can see tat the image is already {{}} but when we view the page, the image is still align to the left. {code}

{code} h3. Work Around Add a space or character in the same line with image, then click the center alignment on the tool bar. The image will be aligned to the center.
fields.summary: Center Alignment is Not Working on Image at Confluence Page Editor

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When there is more than one attachments with the same name attached in different pages under the same page. Only one of the attachment will be shown when you try to search it in the insert image box.
But the two images is definitely exist in the space attachment list.

h3. Way to replicate

# Create a Test Space.
# Create two pages under the space.
# Upload and insert two different image into the pages seperately but name the two attachments with the same name.
# Go to any page and goto *insert files and images*, when you search the image that you just uploaded on *search on other pages*, only one of it is shown.
fields.summary: Only one Attachement is Shown in Search when you have two attachments with the same name in the space.

fields.description:
The "Import Spaces" page in Confluence 5.2-OD-14-1 says:
{quote}
The current Confluence OnDemand accepts back-ups from version 5.1 and newer releases.
{quote}

And, while it does allow the import of a 5.1.x space, all the pages will show up as being created by 'Anonymous', even if the username of original creator of those pages exists in both systems.

I've attached a simple space export from Confluence 5.1.5 with pages made by a user 'admin' to illustrate the problem. Simply ensure an 'admin' user exists in Confluence OnDemand and import this space. All the pages in the space will have been created/modified by 'Anonymous'.

In the database it will look like this:
{noformat}
 contentid |                    title                     | creator
-----------+----------------------------------------------+--------
   2129923 | Importable Space Home                        | NULL
   2129922 | This is admin's page                         | NULL
{noformat}

Either we need to disallow the importing of spaces from Confluence 5.1.x (and adjust the messaging on the page to indicate this) or we need to fix the importing of the user data.
fields.summary: Spaces imported from 5.1.x into OnDemand lose user data

fields.description:
In a panel with the JIRA issue macro, if you position the cursor before the macro, then assign a style via the Dropdown bar, this style will apply to the entire JIRA Issues Macro table.

This makes it possible to have an issues macro table with giant text by accident, and this is not easily seen in Edit mode.

* Steps to reproduce*
Create a new confluence page
Insert a JIRA Issues Macro with a list of issues
Position the cursor before the Macro box.
Select a style
Save the page and view the results.
fields.summary: JIRA issues macro uses Style of character before

fields.description:
Users with 'Confluence Administrator' global permission are currently able to uninstall Lucidchart add-on. 
This operation should require the user to have 'System Administrator' global permission instead.
With the 'Confluence Administrator' global permission only, users should be able to just disable the add-on, not uninstall it.
fields.summary: Administrators can uninstall Lucidchart add-on

fields.description:
h5. Steps to produce:

1. View a blog post. Press the Edit button.
2. Notice the buttons at the bottom of the page. Especially notice the "Unrestricted button". Press it.
3. The blank page.

As you can't set restrictions on Blog posts on Confluence, which is tracked by [CONF-3305|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-3305]. But the button (Unrestricted) is still there, and clicking on it produces a blank page. It'd be better to remove that option from blog posts if the feature is not implemented yet.
fields.summary: Clicking on Page restrictions for Blog post produces a blank page

fields.description:
If a Confluence page, A, has the Attachments macro on it's body and in another Confluence page, B, there's the Include Page macro with A on it, it makes impossible to add attachments to A via B using the Drag-and-Drop feature.

Upload files via the button *browse for files* works just fine.

Tested on latest stable Chrome version.
fields.summary: Impossible to add attachments using Drag-and-Drop when using Include Page macro to show a page with the Attachments macro

fields.description:
Since the latest upgrade in Confluence OnDemand users are getting errors on pages with Lucid Charts. 

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Insert a LucidChart macro in a Confluence page and click the "Select or create LucidChart diagram" link.
# After being redirected to LucidChart select your diagram.
# Select the diagram, after being redirected back to Confluence the selected diagram is not displayed.

A fix is scheduled to be deployed on on Monday 28/Oct.
fields.summary: Lucid Charts no longer working after Confluence's upgrade to 5.3-OD-8

fields.description:
The export site function states:
Normal Export
Generates a PDF file of all pages and blog posts in this space, including comments and attachments.

but the comments are not exported
fields.summary: can't export comments

fields.description: As I tried to include several links, some of them reported page doesn't exist. I could open the page from any other places in Confluence. Upon inspection, I discovered that if there is a colon in the page name, include macro reports page doesn't exist. It seems like there is an error in the parser.
fields.summary: Include macro fails to include page if there is a colon in the name

fields.description:
I've inserted a "Insert JIRA Issue/Filter" macro into a Confluence page. I've selected an issue that has a photo in the attachment of the issue (key is XX-1).
However, no image displays in the "images" column from the macro on the Confluence page. All other data shows up fine.
fields.summary: Images not showing in image column "Insert JIRA Issue/Filter" macro in Confluence

fields.description:
I came across this [question on AAC|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/252952/remove-atlassian-marketing-messages?page=1#253019].

When I went and checked my own test instance, sure enough, the footer is asking me to register Gliffy. Not sure if this has happened when the change to 'Billed by Atlassian' happened, or something else, but we need to stop this from showing up.

I did some more clicking around and realised it is also in the Create dialog. When you select it, you get taken to the editor and shown an error about the licence.
fields.summary: Gliffy behaviour in OnDemand when unlicensed

fields.description:
When attempting to pull in page properties across pages in the same space into a page properties report (some pages of which were created from a simple custom template file that contains a page property macro), a label is applied to the page properties report macro.  The page properties report macro is pulling rows across multiple page property labels in error.

My target is to have separate pages in the space hierarchy for project status (in progress, pending and complete), and moving pages with nested page property tables across pages, updating the label on the page property macros when I do.  That way, I can target inclusion of a page property report macro in each parent page (in progress, pending and complete), and the list presented with change as confluence project pages are moved and labels are modified.  For the overall parent page (entitled Project), my intent was to nested multiple project property report macros, one for each status.

The page property listing are intermingled across most/all labels, I can't make sense of what may be causing the issue of leading to the bug.

Very frustrating! (as all bugs are).  I would appreciate your help, was super pumped about this theoretical implementation, but now am having to rethink altogether the feasibility of using confluence for tracking aggregate project status efficiently as a result.

Thanks in advance for your help!!

My On Demand account is at nbiwindstream.atlassian.net, and the issue I'm having is within the "Projects" page in the 'Network Business Intelligence' space.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report Macro Not Functioning Properly

fields.description:
Confluence attempts to Render .psd files prior to download when using download link directly from a page and produces error such as:
{code}
Image could not be loaded.
Unable to load file from /wiki/download/attachments/2555909/TEST.psd?version=1&modificationDate=1418075094388&api=v2.
{code}

This started with update to version {{5.6-OD-38-053}} Download link works without issue in {{5.6-OD-37-003}}

h3.Steps to reproduce:
# edit page
# Drag .psd file onto screen
# after it loads save
# click Link

h3.Expected
- File Immediately downloads

h3.Actual
- File Attempts to render and errors

h1.Workaround
- copy download link
- Paste in new window to download file
fields.summary: Error 'Unable to load file from' on Download of PSD files

fields.description:
JIRA Issues are normally autolinked in Confluence.

To autolink an issue normally, as long as Application Links are set in the instance between JIRA & Confluence, simply type the issue key in a Confluence page, and click save.  The issue key is turned into a link to the issue.

Something has changed between 5.3-OD-7 and 5.3-OD-11.

Now, to get the autolink, you need to make sure there is a Project/Space Link.  To do this you go to Space Tools > Integrations. It doesn't matter which project you link to, there just needs to be one in order to make the connection.  If there are no project links at all, the autolink will not work at all in that space.  In 5.3-OD-7, it does not behave this way, and you can get the autolink whether there are project links or not.
fields.summary: JIRA Issues are no longer autolinked unless there is the presence of a JIRA Project Link to the Space

fields.description:
h5.Steps to reproduce:

# Install Confluence, and connect to a local Postgres Database
# Do not restore a backup during the setup wizard.
# Continue the Setup Wizard, and create an admin account
# Attempt to restore a Site Export from the Backup/Restore screen in Confluence Admin

h5.Expected Result
Confluence should overwrite the data in the database - the user is logged out, and must log back in with credentials from their restored instance

h5.Actual Result
Confluence reports that there is "No Long Running Task"

h5.Notes:
There are no entries in the log to suggest Confluence even begins the import process.

h5.Workaround
# Perform the import during the Setup Wizard, or;
# Perform the import into Confluence 5.5.3 (either during the setup wizard, or after creating the local instance and local user.
fields.summary: Importing a Site Export will fail with "No Long Running Task"

fields.description:
It looks like if you mention a user , the email is not sent from the default email , defined in Cofnluence.
Probably it is sent from the mentioning user's email.
This causes delivery failiure due to policy reasons in some cases.


Reproduction procedure: 
# open a page for which you have comment permissions
# mention @someone 
# see the email sent. it is not sent from the default cofnleucne email defined in the "From Address " field in the [configure email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+Server+for+Outgoing+Mail] configuration.

Goritsa/Nemetschek_BG

fields.description:
I drag and drop word documents frequently into Confluence for documentation purposes, however if the document I just dragged and dropped has images in it when I select to export that page to PDF it does not show. In fact it resembles a blank space where the pictures should be. I have attached pictures. If I upload files the "long" way this problem still occurs.

The pic attached named "view in confluence" is what a certain document that has images embedded in it look like while it is in confluence. the "after export" picture is what the same document looks like AFTER I have exported it to PDF.

This may sound like a support ticket, but I assure it is not because it happens with every document that has pictures in it, BUT if i paste the pictures directly into confluence they show up in exported PDFs easily. Due to my line of work, doing this for every document with pictures would be terribly inefficient. 


**This issue is identical to that of OFFCONN-105 except I am not using office connector. However, that issue also hasn't been addressed yet even though it was 2 years ago.**
fields.summary: The pictures in a word document when embedded into a confluence page do not show up when exported to PDF

fields.description:
h4. ***Summary***
Images added to a page with a property are displayed with a red hue. This seems to affect the current instance version 5.4-OD-21-019. We have not found a pattern as to how the issue is affecting the pictures attached. The image is attached correctly as confirmed by when looking into the attachments for the page by *Tools > Attachment*

h4. ***Workaround***
Remove image property.
fields.summary: Images get a red hue when adding properties to them

fields.summary: Confluence can not handle images with xmp meta data

fields.description:
With Confluence onDemand we see an unhandled error thrown when you create a meeting note page but leave the title off on the initial save and then try to rectify the problem and save again. 

Details:
Steps to reproduce:

1)	Click Create button
2)	Click meeting notes
3)	Click Create button 
4)	Erase the page title
5)	Click Save
6)	Observe Error message popup at the top of the screen
7)	Close error message
8)	Click in Page title area and type something
9)	Click Save button
10)	Error occurs and you are not able to recover from the error.  Anything you’ve typed is lost.



Oops - an error has occurred
  System Error
A system error has occurred — our apologies!
For immediate troubleshooting, consult our knowledge base for a solution.
If you would like to receive support from Atlassian's support team, ask your Confluence administrator to create a support issue on Atlassian's support system with the following information:
1.	a description of your problem and what you were doing at the time it occurred
2.	a copy of the error and system information found below
3.	a copy of the application logs (if possible).
Your Confluence administrator can use the support request form to create a support ticket which will include this information.
We will respond as promptly as possible.
Thank you!
Return to site homepage…
Cause

fields.description:
To reproduce:
1. Open an EAC page like https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/ENTERPRISE/Reporting+in+JIRA
2. Edit it -> Select all -> Copy
3. Create a new page in CAC like 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ATLAS/Reporting+in+JIRA
4. Paste the content

Witnessed behavior:
The text and formatting pastes fine. Also, the images seem to copy well into the page. I save it and review - all looks fine.

Then a customer looks at the page and doesn't see any images. The root cause being that images were not copied over (like when you right click on an image -> copy image and then paste it into a confluence page) but referenced. So the CAC page references to images on EAC which is Atlassian internal only.

Right now, the only workaround is IMHO to copy&paste each image separately to the new page.

Expected result:
images should be copied as files into the new page, not as references to other confluence systems.
fields.summary: Select All - Copy -> Paste will not paste images but refer to source images.

fields.description:
Administrators could remove "administrators" group without system check for groups with similar permissions. This could drive some customers to simply lock out themselves of Confluence.

This issue is very similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-9360, however, I believe that only a warning (already implemented) isn't sufficient, since in some cases only one user has administrative rights and this could be a very painful situation.

fields.description:
We're in the process of migrating a spec from one JIRA instance into another.
We have done the import once and it worked OK but now want to import again.
In order to do this we've deleted the space that was originally imported and tried to import again from the WebDav export that we've uploaded to the site.
Unfortunately when we try to import again we get the following error:

{code}
Import failed. Check your server logs for more information. com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import: could not insert: [bucket.user.propertyset.BucketPropertySetItem#BucketPropertySetItem[entityId=48267635,entityName=confluence_ContentEntityObject,key=confluence.inline.tasks.sequence.last,type=5,boolean=false,string=8,text=,int=0,double=0.0,long=0,date=]]
{code}

Both the source and target Confluence sites are OnDemand instances
Source: https://apigeesc.atlassian.net/wiki/display/LLBEAN
Target: https://llbean.atlassian.net

The WebDav export is still there in the Target instance if you want to try it again yourself.

Please advise how we can go ahead with doing the import again, this is blocking the migration of our customers space from our instance into theirs
fields.summary: Error when trying to re-import a space

fields.description:
Scope of this issue is to address two specific XSS vulnerabilies. The scope of fixing i18n parameters is [tracked elsewhere|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-15548]. Please see [the comment below for details|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-27396?focusedCommentId=451824&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-451824]. ---- (Original Description) The {{ConfluenceActionSupport.getText}} method is annotated with {{@HtmlSafe}}, forcing the Velocity engine to skip HTML encoding of the methods response. The responsibility of HTML encoding is therefore placed on the caller. There appears to be a common vulnerability in several velocity templates, that take a user controlled variable and pass it as an argument to the {{getText}} method without encoding, leading to XSS vulnerabilities. Two such examples are: {code:title=Managereferrers.vm|borderStyle=solid} #if ($justAdded) #applyDecorator("warning" "") $action.getText("added.exclusion.feedback", [$justAdded, "$req.contextPath/admin/purgesinglereferrer.action?referrer=$justAdded", "$req.contextPath/admin/purgereferrers.action"]) #end #end {code} {code:title=Importword.vm|borderStyle=solid}
$action.getText("office.connector.docimport.whereto"):
{code} It's recommended all callers of the getText() method require HTML encoding of user controlled parameters.
fields.summary: Fix XSS vulnerabilities in managereferrers.vm and importword.vm

fields.description:
Using a Mobile device and going directly to a Confluence page will redirect the user to the Confluence native Mobile Log-in page.

This only happens when going to a page that does not require a redirect, for example:

Going to https://subcon.atlassian.net/wiki/display/ds/Welcome+to+Confluence on a mobile browser shows you the Native Confluence login.

However, going to https://subcon.atlassian.net/wiki/display/ds/ will try to redirect you which then sends the user to the OnDemand login page.

If a user has Google Apps integrated instance, this means that they *cannot* log in using Google Apps when sent to the wrong log in screen.
fields.summary: Mobile browsers directly browsing to Confluence pages will not redirect to OnDemand login page

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# In a new space, create a page with the "Decision" blueprint.

fields.description:
Whenever a user tries to edit the Space Permission and update its information, Confluence fails to do so and report the following error:
{code}
[Error] Error: Syntax error, unrecognized expression: [name=confluence_initial_viewspace_group_<instance_group>]
{code}
It happens if the space has given a permission to a group which has a white space in the group name (i.e test group).

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a Space and create a group with a similar name.
For example:
#* Space: Space test
#* Group: Space test

# Try to update the Space Permission by adding the Space test group.
# Hit Save All.

*Expected behaviour*
# The permissions should be updated.

*Actual*
Nothing happens and all buttons are greyed out.
The following error appears on the console:
{code}
[Error] Error: Syntax error, unrecognized expression: [name=confluence_initial_viewspace_group_<instance_group>]
{code}

*Additional info*
Confirmed this will only affect Webkit based browsers, like Google Chrome and Safari.

*Workaround*
Use other browsers, like Mozilla Firefox or Internet Explorer.
fields.summary: Unable to save changes to Space Permissions for a group containing a whitespace

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Part of the Share Link blueprint is a bookmarklet that links the user to {{/wiki/plugins/sharelinksbookmarklet/bookmarklet.action?bookmarkedURL=<URL-encoded URL>}}. If all the spaces the Confluence user has access to are marked as favorite, instead of seeing the "Share a Link" page they'll see an error saying "You are not allowed to share on this Confluence".

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Give a user access to one single space in Confluence
#* This happens with multiple spaces as well, as long as they are all marked as favorite in step 3
# Log in as that user
# Add the space as a favourite
# Go the Share a Link URL above ({{/wiki/plugins/sharelinksbookmarklet/bookmarklet.action?bookmarkedURL=<URL-encoded URL>}}).

h3. Notes
This seems to be caused by favourite spaces being explicitly removed from the list of spaces that the Share a Link dialog checks against, in [{{BookmarkletAction.java}}|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/confluence-business-blueprints/src/2700e8ccd17de85f51f9e8afb9f0f1ecd8a02571/plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/sharelinksbookmarklet/actions/BookmarkletAction.java?at=master&fileviewer=file-view-default#BookmarkletAction.java-58]:

{code:java}
        // favourite spaces shouldn't appear in the global list as
        globalSpaces.removeAll(favouriteSpaces);
{code}

The comment there isn't cut off by me, that's what it says in the source itself.

h3. Workaround

Either give this user access to another space not marked as favorite or 'unfavorite' the space.
fields.summary: Unable to use "Share a Link" functionality of Share Link blueprint if user has access to a single space and that space is a favourite

fields.description:
This week's Cloud release, the One-click create for blank pages was enabled for Confluence:

* [16 August 2015 to 22 August 2015 - Confluence 5.9.1-OD-65|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/16+August+2015+to+22+August+2015#id-16August2015to22August2015-Confluence5.9.1-OD-65]

However, the [keyboard shortcut|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Keyboard+Shortcuts] *c* is associated to the *Create Blank Page* button  instead of the *Create from template* one. 

In previous versions, when a users clicked on *c*, a pop up to select what kind of content would be created would display:

!old_version.png|thumbnail!

Now, when *c* is clicked, a blank page is displayed instead of the options to create content:

!new_version.png|thumbnail!

The expected behavior would be to show the options for the user to create content, or at least create a new shortcut for that particular *Create from template* button.

fields.description:
Recently I have begun getting a pop-out notification when accessing our Confluence installation which incorrectly states that some users which have been invited to Confluence have yet to log in - as shown here !image-2015-11-05-12-27-41-566.png|thumbnail! .

Due to the way we use our Jira and Confluence installations the users in question *only* have access to Jira, which I have double checked via the User Management screen as shown here !image-2015-11-05-12-30-12-151.png|thumbnail! .

You'll note that the users in question have indeed never accessed the system, so that aspect of the notification is correct. The issue however is this alert doesn't seem to filter to only users with access to this specific application - despite the wording making it appear as though it is filtering.

Can this notification either be reworded to make it reflect its currently generic/global nature. Or ideally be re-coded so that it only reports on users relevant to the application it's displayed within.

We are run our Atlassian products as OnDemand instances.

I hope this helps, let me know if you require any additional information.

h3. Notes
We have [CONF-14838|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-14838] but in this case it's not customers uninstalling a plugin themselves, its likely residual fallout from our [recent announcement|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Documentation+theme+migration+FAQ] . 

h3.Workaround
Schedule a 20 minute maintenance window with the customer and leverage the resolution steps from [this KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Unable+to+find+configured+theme+module+-+Caused+by+Theme+Add-on+Uninstalled+Without+Unsetting+Theme]
fields.summary: Documentation Theme is filling logs with warnings about missing theme

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Team Calendar unable to subscribe Calendar from Charliehr.com

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Generate the URL token from charliehr.com (it should look like this: https://www.charliehr.com/calendar.ics?token=RZVxQdJFjy1yy4duxrPs)
# Go to Team Calendar and click on *Subscribe by URL* button

h3. Expected Result
Calendar will be added

h3. Actual Result
The event is failed to be added

h3. Workaround
Please add it by using *Import Calendar* button
fields.summary: Team Calendar unable to subscribe Calendar from Charliehr.com

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We had several cases where customers are reporting that inline comments are failing to be created.

A customer reports this is intermittent. In our tests, we could reliably reproduce one day and it would fail the other. So, it seems to have moments where it works.

Also, this is not a system problem, it happens in specific pages.

UPDATE: This seems to happen on pages which have been recently edited.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an affected page (by editing the page and leaving the editor)
 # Add in inline comment

h3. Expected Results

It's added .
h3. Actual Results

We get a 'Could not save comment'.

h3. Workaround
Temporary fix is to flush caches in Confluence.
Cloud customers will need to report to a Support Engineer to run this for them.
fields.summary: Confluence not able to add inline comments in pages after editing the page
